comments:
Add some breakpoint in a Java project.

Add a NPE Breakpoint.  After the breakpoint is added, group breakpoints by 
project.  The exception breakpoint will be grouped as part of the first java 
project.

If the breakpoints are grouped by files, the breakpoint will show up as part of 
Others (no file).  I expected the exception breakpoint to be shown in "Others 
(no project)" if the breakpoints are grouped by project since the breakpoint 
does not really belong to any project.  The project that this exception 
breakpoint belongs to seem to be random.  (I think it's the first java project 
JDT can find.)

I think the following problem is a side effect to the way how exception 
breakpoints are linked to a project. But I will mention it here.

I got two java projects.  The NPE breakpoint is some how linked to the first 
project.  Then I run a java debug session from the second project.  This debug 
session suspends at a NPE and printed out stack trace in the console. 

I close the first project (the one that the NPE breakpoint is linked to.)  
Closing the project will cause the NPE breakpoint to be removed.  But clicking 
the link from the console to add the exception breakpoint again resulted in the 
following exception:
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Resource /JSPs is not open.
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.model.Breakpoint.run(Breakpoint.java:337)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.breakpoints.JavaExceptionBreakpoint.<init>
(JavaExceptionBreakpoint.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.core.JDIDebugModel.createExceptionBreakpoint
(JDIDebugModel.java:430)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.console.JavaExceptionHyperLink.linkActivated
(JavaExceptionHyperLink.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.ui.console.TextConsoleViewer.mouseUp
(TextConsoleViewer.java:500)

It looks like we're inconsistent on which resource we associate with exception 
breakpoints - sometimes it the workspace root, and sometimes its the project 
associated with the IJavaType in the JavaModel. We should be consistent (and 
probably associate with workspace root for exceptions in class libs).

This problem has existed forever. A JRE/System library is shared by all 
projects that reference it on its buildpath. However, the Java model 
arbitrarily assigns a JRE to one project (the first one that references is?). 
This problem will exist for any breakpointin a system library (not just 
exception breakpoints).  The breakpoint ends up being associated with the 
project that the Java model assigns to it.

The problem of breakpoint grouping is covered by bug 82867. The breakpoint 
would ideally be shown with "rt.jar" when grouping by file.

The problem of creating a breakpoint associated with a JRE lib that is 
associated with a closed project is fixed by associating breakpoints in 
external archives with the workspace root.

Changes in:

* BreakpointUtils - associated with workspace root instead of project
* JavaExceptionHyperLink - use BreakpointUtils to determine resource
* JavaStackTraceHyperlink - if the exception can't be found by source locator 
(due to closed project) search the workspace too
